result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen L. Gholson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programs ordered by the agent.

Serve 10 days conditional time in the jail; huber/work release granted.

State has 30 days to submit claim for restitution.  Defense will have 15 days to object and request restitution hearing if not in agreement with the amount of the claim.  If the Court receives nothing within 30 days, restitution to be set at $0.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.  Probation is concurrent on Counts 1 and 2 with conditional jail time ordered as part of the probation on Count 1.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: With work release/huber and stayed until on or before July 15, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.

records.addlTxt:
10:05 a.m.  Defendant Allen L. Gholson in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank. Prosecuting Atty Timothy James Gaskell appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin in 15CM197/sentencing after revocation.  ADA Amy Forehand appears for the State of Wisconsin for 15CM132/sentencing after revocation, 15CF92/sentencing after revocation, 16CF79/sentencing after revocation, and 17CM23 and 16CM160/adjourned initial.

DA Gaskell addresses the Court in 15CM197.  ADA Forehand addresses the Court in the other sentencing after rev cases.  Atty. Frank addresses the Court.  Def addresses the Court.

Sentence after revocation: 

15CM197 - Count 1 and 2, both battery:  9 months year jail both counts, concurrent.  

15CF92 - Counts 2 (disorderly conduct) and 4 (bail jumping):  Count 2 - 90 days, consecutive to Counts 1 and 2 of 15CM197; Count 4 - 9 months concurrent with all other charges

15CM132 - Count 2, criminal damage to property with d.a. enhancer:  9 months concurrent with all other charges

16CF79 - Count 1, bail jumping:  9 months concurrent with all other charges.

Credit:  52 days credit on everything except for Count 2 of 15CM92.

Costs have already been imposed; any remaining now as civil judgment.

Adjourned initials in 17CM23 and 16CM160 - formal reading waived.  NG previously entered in 16CM160; entered now also in 17CM23, def having stood mute.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Status requested and set for 3/29 at 9:00.
Judge Sharp gave Tim Gaskell, Spec. Pros. permission to appear by telelphone for the 2/10/17 hearing at 10:00 a.m. slm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 10, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Several cases called together, four of them subject to revocation:  16CF79, 15CM197, 15CM132, and 15CF92.  Also called:  new filing 17CM23 and adjourned initial 16CM160. 

In 15CM197, special prosecutor Tim Gaskell appears by phone for the State.  In all of the other cases, ADA Forehand appears for the State.  Defendant appears in custody for all matters, appearing today without counsel.  It has been noted that Def is presently without counsel while SPD looks for an attorney who can take the cases despite numerous conflicts between the cases and co-defendants.  

Def states that he wants to proceed to sentencing after rev in the 4 revoked cases.  ADA Forehand notes rev order/warrant just came through; State is not prepared to go forward with sentencing today.  

Court resets all matters to 2/10 at 10.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for February 10, 2017 at 10:00 am.
scheduling correspondence between clerk and counsel re SAR calendaring
Clerk notified special prosecutor Tim Gaskell of the 2/1 10 a.m. status via notice by email.
Status conference on February 1, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Revocation Order and Warrant (case number corrections)

JG

Defendant Allen L. Gholson in court, in custody (on pending bail hrg matter; no in custody on this case) with attorney Dominic J. Anderson. Prosecuting Atty Timothy James Gaskell appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby def will plead to counts 1 and 2; counts 3 and 4 to be dismissed and read-in; agreement calls for recommendation of 2 years probation with 10 days jail as a condition.  Def pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.

Credit: 3 days.

Sentence on counts 1 and 2:  Withheld for 2 years probation.  Conditions:  Attend, pay for, successfully complete any programs ordered by agent; 10 days jail; 3 days credit if revoked from probation. Jail stayed for 30 days - Friday, July 15 between 6-7 a.m.  State to have 30 days to submit restitution order; if def disagrees with the amount, he can request restitution hearing; if nothing received within 30 days from the state, restitution to be set at $0.

10 days conditional jail ordered on count 1.  Probation concurrent counts 1 and 2.

Counts 3 and 4 DRI.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Allen L. Gholson in court with attorney Dominic J. Anderson. Prosecuting Atty Tim Gaskell appeared for State of Wisconsin by telephone. Parties have reached agreement, requests plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
